“Alright, this way...”

You lead the party around the city's wall toward one of the outer bridges, passing far below where you spawned when you first started, where you were immediately tested by a fight to the death. Stone caves spiral down into the white abyss beneath Averron, until you find yourself on a familiar lower strata, an enormous suspended stone platform like Averron City sans buildings.

You've fought here before.

You draw your longsword. It's heavier than expected, but looks like it'll be a lot easier to swing or thrust than some of the weapons you've been stuck with thus far. You needed something dependable anyway. Seems like you could wield it in either one or two hands, depending on what you fancy.

“Is this the place?” Aelriss asks. The ribbon on her finger uncoils, blooming brightly into the shape of a bird that comes to rest on her shoulder. Tatsumaki taps her and nods in confirmation.

“Mhm. Last time we were here, we lost someone to a surprise boss fight.” You suggest. It's quiet, though. “We're a fair bit stronger now, though, even if it is just us three. Last time, they attacked from underground.”

“Hm...” Aelriss wields her wrought-iron staff. It's just short of her height, and you hear wind faintly whistling, even when she moves it minutely. “I don't see anything.”

> Suggest doing something to draw them out from underground.
> Suggest trying to aggro them off distant cave walls.
> Suggest looking in one of the caves nearby.
